intro: Calibrachoa serrulata, commonly known as the serrated calibrachoa, is a flowering plant native to the Andes mountains of South America. It is a member of the Solanaceae family, which includes nightshades, and is characterized by its trailing growth habit and vibrant flowers. The plant produces small, bell-shaped flowers in shades of red, orange, and yellow, which bloom throughout the growing season. Its foliage is typically covered in fine, serrated leaves that give it its scientific name. Calibrachoa serrulata is often cultivated as an ornamental plant in gardens and containers due to its attractive appearance and relatively low maintenance requirements.
